work.name: Lucid Software
work.description: The websites listed here encompass +10,000 individual pages, 9 languages, millions of visitors each month, and many integrations with external systems. Using a decoupled setup with Drupal as a CMS and Gatsby.js as a site builder we managed all of these sites from a unified codebase and custom component library. Unit and end to end testing helped maintain a solid level of reliability.

work.name: Amazon - CuSP
work.description: Created for Amazon - I was flown out to Seattle with a small team to quickly create a working web-app to allow users to quickly and easily create stories and games for Alexa to read. Complex UI, responsive design, complex data manipulation, locally saving data if network connection failed, API integrations, and much more.

work.name: Campbell's Kitchen
work.description: WordPress theme built for Campbell's company with an emphasis on reusability and creating child themes from the parent. We rebuilt the entire site to be responsive and beautiful.

work.name: Face The Issue
work.description: A static site that uses CSS animations and page transitions to engage the user. Fairly complex layouts and animations that needed to work smoothly and transition to mobile seamlessly. Creating custom Google maps themes and integration was fun and interesting.

work.name: Nu Skin - ageLOC Me
work.description: This started as a web-app, but late in the process Nu Skin decided they wanted it to work on both iOS and Android - so we performed some miracles and, using Phonegap, were able to get this app working on web - iOS - and Android. The complex and responsive UI, CSS animations, circle sliders, and progressive special facial effects all added up to be quite a complex piece.

work.name: Hookd
work.description: A landing and promotional page for an app that no longer exists - this site used scroll jacking (not a fan by the way) to control the experience a little. Also a lot of use of CSS animations and some complex parallax animations to engage the user.

work.name: Poke Quiz - Amazon Echo Show
work.description: I was one of the first people to ever work with the new (at the time) echo show device from Amazon. It was quite tricky to use and create compelling visuals for a skill due to the restrictions of Amazon's templating system, but I was able to find some creative ways to get this skill to work how I wanted.

work.name: RAIN - Strata
work.description: An internal tool that I started at Rain. The hope was to have an easy way to learn about the Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities of our ever learning employees. The project was never finished, but got to an almost complete state before tabled. Complex database relationships kept the records linked to make for easy and useful searching functionality.

personal.name: Acrodoodle (WIP)
personal.description: This is my current side project. It was my first idea for a website back in 2010 and a friend and I built the whole thing out without any knowledge of how to actually build a website. The fact that we got it up and running at that time still amazes me. Recentlt I decided that maybe it was time to try to ressurect the project. There is still a ton to do, but I just chip away at it when I get the time.

personal.name: Recall
personal.description: This was intended to be a useful tool for avid readers of long book series. Users could create a chapter by chapter summary of a book to help get more of a refresher than a Wikipedia article, but much less than having to re-read the entire book. Amazon API integration - Fun CSS animations and transitions. It never found much traction so it only got a little use for a short time.

personal.name: BabyBook
personal.description: A side project I created to have a 'Cloud' based baby book for my son. While I had maybe hoped to make it robust enough to open to others, I have yet to do so. Fun customization options.

personal.name: TokenCreator
personal.description: A side project I wanted to create to help D&D players and creators easily create custom tokens for their table top games. The intention was to create printing templates that users could use from home. I have yet to advertise the site in any way yet so it does not get any use yet. The largest blocker currently is trying to build something that will work on any printer despite all of the factors that could come into play when dealing with printing and printer differences.
